title: Wen Zhanli
text:
Wen Zhanli (; born 1981) is a Chinese composer living in <a href="Beijing">Beijing</a>.
Life.
Wen Zhanli was born in <a href="Beijing">Beijing</a> and studied music since childhood. He admitted to the composition department at <a href="China%20Conservatory%20of%20Music">China Conservatory of Music</a> and studied composition in 1999. In 2006, he studied at <a href="Darmstadt%20International%20Summer%20Courses%20for%20New%20Music">Darmstadt International Summer Courses for New Music</a> in Germany. He attained a doctor's degree in 2010 from China Conservatory of Music and starting working as a teacher at the composition department.
His music is a variety of styles and genres, including <a href="opera">opera</a>, <a href="symphony">symphony</a>, <a href="chamber%20music">chamber music</a>, <a href="electronic%20music">electronic music</a>, <a href="Choir">chorus</a>, <a href="film%20music">film music</a>, <a href="Pop%20music">pop song</a>, <a href="performance%20art">performance art</a>, <a href="conceptual%20art">conceptual art</a> and <a href="new%20media%20art">new media art</a>. In 2005 and 2007, he held a personal concert twice and won favorable reception. Some of his works premiered and were selected into national and international concert and music festivals including the 2008 <a href="Shanghai%20Spring%20International%20Music%20Festival">Shanghai Spring International Music Festival</a>, 2008 Young China Music Festival in Frankfurt Germany and 2011 Young Composer Project of <a href="National%20Centre%20for%20the%20Performing%20Arts%20%28China%29">National Centre for the Performing Arts (China)</a> etc. In 2008 and 2013, he won the excellent prize of music composition of "Wenhua Award" twice, which is a governmental award conferred by the ministry of culture of China.
